rules.description: Next.js 15+ requires React 19 for full compatibility
Next.js 16 requires React 19 for full compatibility
React 19 has better TypeScript support with TS 5+

rules.constraint: tailwindcss 4.x has new config format for next.js
rules.description: Tailwind CSS 4 has new configuration format

rules.constraint: supabase works with next.js app router (recommended)
rules.description: Supabase integrates well with Next.js App Router

knownIssues.description: Material-UI (MUI) may have compatibility issues with React 19. Some hooks and features may not work correctly.
knownIssues.suggestion: Consider using shadcn/ui, Chakra UI v3, or wait for MUI v7 with full React 19 support

knownIssues.description: Recoil may have issues with React 19's concurrent features
knownIssues.suggestion: Consider using Zustand or Jotai for state management with React 19

knownIssues.description: Using Next.js with Express requires custom server setup, which disables some Vercel optimizations
knownIssues.suggestion: Consider using Next.js API Routes instead of Express for simpler deployment

knownIssues.description: Vue 2 has limited TypeScript support compared to Vue 3
knownIssues.suggestion: Consider upgrading to Vue 3 for better TypeScript support

knownIssues.description: Angular and React are different frameworks and should not be used together in the same application
knownIssues.suggestion: Choose either Angular or React, not both

knownIssues.description: Vue and React are different frameworks and should not be used together in the same application
knownIssues.suggestion: Choose either Vue or React, not both

knownIssues.description: Using Tailwind CSS with Material-UI may cause style conflicts and increased bundle size
knownIssues.suggestion: Use one styling solution or configure Tailwind to exclude MUI components

knownIssues.description: Using both Prisma and Mongoose in the same project can lead to confusion in data modeling
knownIssues.suggestion: Choose one ORM: Prisma for SQL databases, Mongoose for MongoDB

knownIssues.description: Jest and Vitest are both test runners. Using both may cause configuration conflicts
knownIssues.suggestion: Choose Vitest for Vite projects, Jest for webpack projects

knownIssues.description: Vite and Webpack are both build tools. Using both adds unnecessary complexity
knownIssues.suggestion: Choose Vite for new projects, keep Webpack for legacy projects
